data.name: Moving element in an array
data.description:
Let's make a prototype function which can 'move' an element of an array, and then return the result as a new array.

The 'move' function accepts two parameters. _from_ and _to_. The former is the index of the element you want to reorder, the latter is the destination index of that element.

There are two conditions:

1. If the array does not have the _from_ index, return 'no target'.

2. If the destination index is beyond the length of array, append `undefined` values to the end of the array until it is large enough to perform the movement.


```javascript
var arr = ["a", "b", "c"];

arr.move(0,2); // -> ["b", "c", "a"]
arr.move(2,0); // -> ["c", "a", "b"]
arr.move(1,5); // -> ["a", "c", undefined, undefined, undefined, "b"]
arr.move(5,1); // -> 'no target'
arr            // -> still ["a", "b", "c"]

```
